intro: Canthium sambiranense, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, three-lobed capsules. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Canthium sambiranense is used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
